solution_line_template: {pounds_of_apples} pounds of apples at ${cost_per_pound_apples}/pound would cost {pounds_of_apples}*{cost_per_pound_apples} = $<<{pounds_of_apples}*{cost_per_pound_apples}={cost_apples}>>{cost_apples}

If we add all of the purchases together then the total bill was {cost_apples}+{cost_pie_crust}+{cost_lemon}+{cost_butter} = $<<{cost_apples}+{cost_pie_crust}+{cost_lemon}+{cost_butter}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
There are {num_servings} servings per pie. So ${total_cost}/{num_servings} servings = ${cost_per_serving} per serving
